column5: Saw this brilliant orange bird today in my tree, does anyone know what it is.  It was just gorgeous and I've never seen one like it before.  Sorry for the fuzzy pics, but I had to act fast and not scare it and its through the front window on zoom.        Thanks  Joey
Yep...I concur....looks like a Baltimore Oriole.
Baltimore Oriole, isn't it a little far from home  Thanks guys, looks like you're right.  I don't recall ever seeing one before.  It was beautiful.  Joey
Joey....here is a link with pics of the bird that you saw in your tree.  http://images.google.ca/imgres?imgurl=http...l%3Den%26sa%3DN  Leechman
I'd say the Blue Jays would come and beat on them, but hey, that's just not gonna happen now is it???
Audubon says they range as far north as the top of the Great lakes in summer.  JF
see them every summer here in nw ont

Definately a Balt Oriole. For any other Bird Nerds out there, here is a great site for IDing birds. Use the bottom of the page (attributes) to narrow down the attributes that you know, one at a time. Works well.  http://identify.whatbird.com/mwg/_/0/attrs.aspx   Great resource for IDing bird voices too.
It's a Baltimore Oriole as per page 259 of my Roger Tory Peterson field guide. Very good you bird watchers.

Very cool bird, eh Joey!  I don't see 'em very often here around Hamilton but every now and then one flies through.  I work in Waterloo and will see one every so often on my drive from Hamilton to Waterloo, particularly in the rural areas.  Now, I thought they changed the common name of the Baltimore Oriole to Northern Oriole.  Nice bird either way.
